function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of SEIRD model for disease propagation","Impact":"Potential inaccuracies in modeling disease spread","Mitigation":"Validate model outputs with real-world data, consider additional models for comparison","Technologies":"Data validation, alternative modeling software","People":"General public, policymakers","Owner":"Epidemiologists, public health officials"},{"Description":"Interpretation of Bentley Stringency Index (BSI)","Impact":"Potential misunderstanding of the level of restrictions and their significance","Mitigation":"Provide clear explanations of BSI, its components, and their impact on disease spread","Technologies":"Data visualization, communication tools","People":"Policy makers, researchers, general public","Owner":"Public health experts, government agencies"},{"Description":"Different combinations of restrictions within a state","Impact":"Difficulty in assessing the effectiveness of specific measures","Mitigation":"Collect granular data on the implementation and impact of individual restrictions, analyze local and statewide data separately","Technologies":"Data collection tools, spatial analytics","People":"Policy makers, local authorities","Owner":"Epidemiologists, data analysts"}]}
